text: Very nice. Coffee, a bit of sweetness: Molasses in the back. Very well balanced. Nice carbonation. Toasted. Chocolate and toasted nuts.

Black color, brown head. Coffee nose, dried fruit, nuts, licorice, roasted malt, burnt sugar. Sweet licorice taste, roasted malt, bread, coffee, peppery notes, bitter finish, well balanced. Full body, soft carbonation, oily texture.

Refrigerated brown bomber poured into a glass. Black with medium light brown head. Aroma is medium body, medium carbonation, and thick small-bubble lacing. Taste is big roasted malt, soy sauce, coffee, some spicy rye, and some a little dark chocolate.

Eccellente stout dal colore nero con bella schiuma sottile marrone. Al naso potente esplode di caffè, malto tostato, cioccolato. La bevuta scorre bene, corpo leggero e beverina, fosse stata più cremosa sarebbe stata clamorosa. Morbida, con tostatura, caffè e cioccolato che accompagnano fino alla fine. Chiude appena amara in ottimo equilibrio. Carbonazione bassa.

Bottle. Black with nice lasting foam. Aroma is licorice, coffee and roasted. Taste is dominated by rye, but includes licorice, coffee, dark chocolate and some alcohol (but not much at all). Very nice full body. A quality brew!
Bottle.Black colour with medium beige head.Aroma is roasted and malty with taste of dark chocolate and coffee,good full body and hint of dark dried fruits and toasted caramel.

Would love to taste imperial version of this, but anyways, its awesome. Moderate roasted malts, some bread aspect, dark choco, light berry like kick, light smoked. Moderate to ligth sweetness, moderate bitterness.
Like it

From the tap, at FOB, Rimini, Italy. Pours black with coffee-like foam. Aroma is coffee, hazelnut. Body is medium, with some stickiness. Taste is moderate in both sweetness and bitterness. Nice balance. Finish is persistent and pleasant.

Bottle from Vinmonopolets BU. Pours close to black, with a tiny, almost non existing, brown head. Roasted malt and coffee flavour, toast, bitter herbs, pine, hints of dark fruit and very dark chocolate. Extremely bitter aftertaste. Full, thick body. Surprisingly high carbonation. Very good, maybe a tiny bit too bitter.

500ml bottle from Boxbeers.com - Batch: 1465 BBE: 11/2019.


Black colour with a dark brown head. Burned coffee, hoppy, liquorice, good drinkability. Nice one!

Bottle, batch 1465 (from UJH). Pours dark brown-black with brown head. The head stays. Aroma is rye, spices, dark chocolate, roast, malt, metallic notes, iron. Flavor is sweet and bitter, very burnt roast, malt, coffee, chocolatemetallic notes. Finish is burnt, metallic and booze. Overall: drinkable beer. This is from the more is better school (rye is the best part of this!), but Im not really enjoying this, too burnt for me.

(500ml bottle from kihoskh.dk, BB 11/2019) Pours pitch black with a huge, dense mocha-coloured head that fades slowly leaving a truly beautiful wall of lace. Aroma of heavily roasted, smoky malts with ash and iodine, dark bitter chocolate, cocoa powder, light coffee, dark rye bread, light hoppy notes. Flavour is semi-sweet dark malt and brown sugar, semi-sweet chocolate, quite heavy roasted malt, a little ash and smoke on the back end, black coffee, vanilla accents, a touch of liquorice, spicy rye building into the finish that has fairly hefty hop bitterness, pine resin and slight citrus, and quite a lot of bitter roast as well. Lingering chocolate notes. Quite full and thick body with creamy carb. This is a tour de force for a <8% stout, huge flavours and mouthfeel, heavily bitter but still pretty balanced. That being said, as it warms, the bitterness can become a bit overwhelming, almost like a big black IPA on the back end.

Pours black oily color, haze/opaque, with creamy light brown head. Aroma: intense malts aroma, with notes of espresso coffee, dark cacao coffee, cacao nibs, hint of peat, roasted, hint of molasses & licorice, some rye spicy notes, citrusy, piny notes of hops....
Flavor: medium roasted grain & malts flavor, which takes on espresso coffee, dark chocolate, cacao, lighty burnt - peated, supported with gentle dark fruits esters, slightly spicy note of rye, moderate hop flavor with notes of citruses and pine...but hop bitterness is high. Finish is dry. Body is full, almost very full (plato 22°!!!?), texture smooth almost creamy, carbonation is medium. What a surprise!

Pours black with medium brown head. Aroma is coffee beans, strong roast, some sourness, oat, caramel, vanilla pie, coffee, chocolate. Taste is coffee, vanilla, oily, some grass, bitterness, caramel, dark chocolate, green beans. Super beer!

Bottle @deTolly, Tartu. Pours dark brown with dark brown sticky medium head. Aroma: roasted, coffee, dark chocolate, bitterish, burnt wood, bready. Taste: medium bitter, a bit sourish for a second(rye), bread, dark bitter chocolate, woody, Full body. Bitter finish. That thing is better than most of Imperial Stout. WOW.
Not bad, but not deserving of the hype. After a few, hop profile becomes overbearing. I guess thats what you get at this bitterness level.
Towering dark pour, frothy head. Profound malt notes, reasonably sessionable for 80 IBUs. Colour is robust and taste profile clean.

500ml bottle. Dark brown beer, medium brown head. Nose is hops and cocoa dust, woody notes. Flavor is roast, dark chocolate, a hint of coffee. Hoppy bitterness and mild rye acidity in the finish, chocolate notes, woody dryness. Aftertaste has milder, but still pretty bitter, hops, chocolate and rye. Smooth mouthfeel, hides the ABV well.

Creamy black pour with a crema like head. The nose is seriously roasted with smokey meat and coffee. The taste is medium full with pretty big coffee and raw licorice, a little sweetness from the rye and substantial bitterness too - not overly complex. The mouthfeel is medium rich and nice and oily. Drying finish and aftertaste, developing into bitterness.

50cl bottle. Pitch black pour with a tall espresso head with decent retention. Notes of roasted malts, dark chocolate, licorice, more roasted malts and some smoke. Full body, thick and oily, medium to low carbonation and a roasty bitter finish. An excellent Russian imperial stout.

Bottle. Epic first pour with a towering dark tan pile of foam. The foam quickly does a disappearing act. This has big portions of bitter chocolate, dark sugar and rum. This comes across as a hefty stout. (#6443, 11/30/2016)

Pours black with a large frothy mocha head. Aromas of chocolate, roasted malt, roasted nuts, fruity notes, brown sugar, lactose. Taste is roasted and chocolatey and quite fruity with a very nice bitterness. Mouthfeel is creamy and smooth with a dry finish. Great stuff!
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Na pewno jeden z lepszych FESów jakie piłem.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a RyeKing by Amager Bryghus at Kufle i KapsleBardzo kawowy, sporo ciala z zytem w uscie, dym bardzo delikutasny, pasuje miOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Draught. Almost black with tan head. Aroma of chocolate, rye bread, roastiness and some fruits. In taste sweet with rye sour note, flavour is chocolate, coffee. Medium body, soft carbonation, solid bitteness and some alcohol in finish. Really solid stout.

Jest wpisany jako FES, ale spokojnie mógłby być RISem. W aromacie sporo palności, kawy, ciemnej czekolady. W smaku podobnie - paloność i czekolada, trochę mniej kawy, wychodzą gdzieniegdzie jakieś słodsze nuty, ale ogólnie smakuje jak bardzo klasyczny, palony i raczej wytrawny RIS. Goryczka wysoka, kawowa, może nieco za ostra. Poza tym piwo bardzo dobrze ułożone.

Draught at TAPS in KL. Pitch black pour with a little tan head that sticks around the edges. Aroma isnt too strong - general roasted notes with some burnt dark chocolate. Taste is also sort of unremarkable - solid straight down the middle stout with some dark dark chocolate, coffee, a hint of licorice but not in a way I dislike. Super creamy palate, but not too thick. This is the beers best feature I think. Solid but wouldnt get again sort of a disappointment.

I drank this beer yesterday at the Pibar Lausanne at the draft. It is a perfect foreign stout, we could say that it is an imperial stout. The color is black and there is a small brown foam. The carbonation is low but it is normal for the style. The taste is simply powerful, roasted malt, coffee, hop, vanilla, licor, plum. It is just wonferful and you drink it step by step. It is the paradise on the earth.
Bottle. Color dark brown with a small chocolate head. Aroma roasted, malt, fruits, chocolate. Taste sweet, malt, acid, chocolate, bread.

Fra fad på DØE Lokomotivhallen mai-16 (dag 2) med Steven: kulsort med kort skum. Aroma af mørkbrente malter og ditto kaffe. Rugsyrligheden er påtagende i smagen, sammen med kaffe og overmodne solbær. Lang og tør eftersmag. 10 cl var akkurat nok.

Aroma of roasted coffee, spices, rye, umami, salty meat. 
Pours pitch black, two finger thick creamy brown head. 
Taste is medium bitter, very light sweet. 
Medium plus body, roasted coffee and spices. 
Well done.
Cervezon! Notas de frutos secos y chocolate en aroma. Sabores torrefactos con un punto dulce algo licorizado. Cuerpo denso y espuma color toffe y consistente

Tap at Kufle i Kapsle, Warsaw. Near black with a brown head. Looks the part. Notes of liquorice, molasses and roast dominate things. Slight spiciness from the grain and quite a chewy mouthfeel. Good stuff but a bit below my expectations.
Negro opaco y espuma beis compacta. Aromas de chocolate, cacao, café y tostados. Cuerpo sedoso y denso, sabor de cacao y café con final de amargor quemado equilibrado.

Aroma: chocolate. roasty, coffee, some citrus
Taste: medium(to high) bitter, light sweet, roasty, chocolate, citrus

Draught at Mikkeller Bangkok. Black color, brown head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, espresso, nuts and a bit of chocolate. Bitter finish with roasted malts, nuts, espresso and a bit of chocolate. Very nice foreign stout.
brown to black body which is full.one finger brown foam that doesnt last.bready, malty with tones of coffee and a little bit acidic taste.the aftertaste lasts quite a bit.liked it for sure

Pours dark brown to black with a small tan and chocolate brown head. Aroma is dark roasted malt and vague fruity. Dark malty, distinct breadish and mild acidic. Lasting dry breadish. Lasting dark breadish and roasted malty finish

Tap at Hair of the Dog Bangkok. Pours a dark ass brown with a nice dense beige head that lasts days like a boner after a park of viagra, smells of toasted grainy bread, taste is is sharp bitter that turns into a bit of sour rye yeasty bread. Solid stout but I don't get any chocolate or vanilla like some people have said in their reviews.

Multitap Gdańsk
Aromat - Mocna paloność, kawa z mlekiem, czekolada. Świetny smak, zapowiada dobre piwo.
Wygląd - Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta (było ciemno). Piana gęsta, beżowa, drobnopęcherzkowa, piana została do końca.
Smak - Kawa, czekolada, kremowość od żyta. Piwo ciężkie, ale bardzo pijalne. Lekka kwaśność od palonych słodów. Goryczki brak. Wysycenie niskie.

Kolor: czarny, z delikatnymi rubinowymi refleksami.
Piana: bardzo obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, zwarta, trwała, zdobi szkło.
Zapach: intensywne aromaty ciemnych słodów, gorzka czekolada, kawa, kakao, wyraźne aromaty palone, dymne.
Smak: bardzo gęste, aksamitne, również zdominowany przez ciemne słody,sporo gorzkiej czekolady, kakao, kawy, goryczka średnia bardziej kojarząca się z tymi aromatami niż z chmielem.
Wysycenie; średnie, w kierunku niskiego.

500 ml, kran. Wygląd świetny idealnie czarne, piana lekko przypieczona, gęsta, oblepia szkło. W aromacie kawa mocna, gorzka czekolada, kakao, chmiel. W smaku goryczka spora, leciutko kwaśne od ciemnych słodów. Odczucie wypełniające. Ogólnie świetne.

Bottle. Sensoric. Deep black with light brown, densed, big head. Great head retention and lacing. Nice roasted malts aroma - coffee, liquorice, rye bread, some black fruits - berries, light vanilla. Taste is medium to high bitter, with some coffee acidicy. ALmos full body, oily and thick texture, soft carbonation, finish is medium long and bitter. In general very complex, thick beer. Definetley worth trying.
On tap at Taphouse, Copenhagen. Dark brown with brownish head. Roasted malts, chocolate and strong coffee flavor. Medium bodied. Dry bitter finish. Good one.

Bottle pour into a brandy snifter. The beer is dark brown to black with a khaki head of foam. The aroma has a lot of the rye character coming through. I get a big spice and chocolate character in the taste. Bigger body and medium carbonation. The rye spice is really the dominant character in this beer. Very nice.

Bottle split at Reubens, thanks to he, 02/05/15.
Pitch black with a big old tan covering. 
Nose is rich roast, chocolate, Rye notes, light spice, dark fruit.
Taste comprises mellow dark fruits, roast malt, Chocolate Maltesers, mineral notes, chocolate milk shake, light vanilla.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close. 
Decent stout, good balance, comes together well.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Black colour, nice beige head. Sweet aroma, some coffee, roastness and rye. Bitter, roasted taste, some sourness, coffe and also rye.

500 ml bottle, batch #272, from the brewery. BB date 07.2014. ABV is 7.7%. Pitch black colour, moderate brown head. Aroma of liquorice and black rye bread, also coffee and fruity hops, just a hint of smoke. The flavour has roast malts, coffee and liquorice, also piney hops, black rye bread and a hint of smoke. Good beer. Gets even better as it warms up a little. Im upping a point or two.

June 18, 2015. Bottle at home, batch 426, best before march 2015. 
Black with a large, creamy, brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, dark rye bread, chocolate, coffee, some earthy and dark fruit notes. Taste is sweet malty with licorice, black berries, spicy rye bread, coffee, milk chocolate. Finish is light to medium dry bitter roasted with salty and spicy rye notes. Medium bodied, creamy, oily texture, soft carbonation.

50cl bottle. Small beige head atop black body. Aroma is moderately sweet, earthy, milk/bittersweet chocolate, light smoke. Taste is moderately sweet, roast, some coffee, earthy, grapefruit, bittersweet chocolate, light smoke. Medium body, some stickiness.

500 ml bottle. Black body with a small brown head. Strong aroma of dark malt, chocolate, smooth roasted coffee and rye bread. Flavor is smooth, sweet, dark roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, rye and nice bitterness. Fine balanced body and good, long lasting aftertaste. Another nice one from Amager.

Bottle. Pours inky black, large puffy brown head, creamy and slow to dissipate, nice lacing left behind. Aroma is roasty, hoppy, pine, chocolate, anise, tobacco, ashtrays, coffee. Flavor is pretty light sweet, quite bitter, a hint of burned rubber, but very roasty, borderline burned malts, lots of anise and dark unsweetened cocoa, ashtrays. Fullish body. This is a solid one for those who like their impys (and lets face it, this sits right on that border), with low sweetness and high bitterness.

Po przelaniu do szkła tworzy się gęsta obfita, brązowa piana, trwała i pięknie oblepiająca szkło, barwa ciemno brązowa, prawie czarna z nieśmiałymi rubinowymi refleksami. Aromat mocno palony, kawowy, kakaowy, ale nie słodki, bardziej gorzki koniak, trufle. Po ogrzaniu się dochodzi dojrzałe mango i marakuja. W smaku paloność i spora goryczka na pierwszym planie, w głębi czekoladowo-waniliowe nuty, włoskie orzechy, posmak whisky, torfu i starego drewna. W odczuciu lekko ziemiste, średnia w stronę wysokiej pełni, nieduża słodycz marcepanowa, delikatna kwaśność od palonych i wędzonych słodów. Nagazowanie niskie, w afterteasie suszone śliwki węgierki, cygaro i chmielowo-popiołowa gorzkość. Alkohol perfekcyjnie ukryty. 
Raczej wytrawny i ekstremalny Stout, z z nieco zalegającą goryczką zapożyczoną od Black IPA i agresywnością RISa w intensywności doznań sensowycznych. Oczywiście brak tu nieco więcej ciała, ale i tak jest dobrze. Piwo intrygujące, skierowane zdecydowanie do beer geeków i hop headów.

[4/28/15] Draught at Taphouse in Copenhagen. Black with a nice light brown head. Nice roasty aroma with dark chocolate and some coffee. Bittersweet flavor, roast, with chocolate, espresso, and a burnt bitter finish. Full-bodied.

Aromat: czekoladowy, palony, kawowy, lekko słodki. Barwa: czarna i nieprzejrzysta. Piana jasno-brązowa, drobno pęcherzykowa i średnio utrzymująca się. Smak: słodycz, lekko kwaskowość, do tego goryczka na średnim poziomie, lekko alkoholowa i zalegająca. Pełnia: średnia. Finisz palono-kawowo-alkoholowy. Podsumowując, smaczny, palony stout ocierający się o RISa z trochę drażniącym aromatem alkohlowym.

50cl bottle thanks to Papsoe. Color is dark brown to dark. Head is super persistent and brown. Body is smooth and medium. Nice light sweetness and medium bitterness. Quite balanced. Aroma is chocolate, roasted, coffee, oh so smooth!!

Aromat: czekolada, akcenty ziemiste i chlebowe słodu żytniego, lekka paloność i kwaskowość. Do tego nuty estrów w postaci śliwek i wiśni.

Barwa: czarna, nieprzejrzysta. Piana jasno brązowa, drobno pęcherzykowa, względnie ofita i utrzymująca się. 

Smak: słodycz, złamana kwaskowością. Następnie czekolada, kawa, palność i zdecydowane nuty ziemiste. Wyrazisty smak stoutowy. Umiarkowana do wysokiej goryczka, wzmacniana przez palononość. Nieco drażniąca i dość długa. Średnia do krągłej pełnia, umiarkowane wysycenie. Wytrawny palonono- kawowo- ziemisty finisz z niewielką nuta alkoholową.

Ciekawe piwo z pogranicza FES oraz IS. Za mocne na to pierwsze, a zbyt słabe na drugie. Konkretny aromat i smak, jak na mocny stout przystało.
Bottle shared at home with Colin - black pour with tan head. Roasted malty aroma and taste, rye, oaty, some burnt notes, chocolate, caramel, brown sugar, roasted finish.

Tap (VI FDP). Barwa czarna, mega bezowa piana, obfita, gesta. Aromat czekoladowy z delikatnymi nutami palonymi. W smaku czekoladowe, delikatne, glagkie, alkohol swietnie ukryty, tylko przyjemnie rozgrzewa od srodka. Pije sie bardzo przyjemnie.

Tap at the Ørsted Ølbar, Copenhagen. Poured a dark mahogany witn a frothy broken tan head. The aroma is rich roasted malt light toffee caramel. The flavour is moderate to strong bitter with a smoky roast, coffee liqourice bitter palate. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation.
Poured deep dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of berries, fudge, chocolate and roast malt. Medium body, flavour as the aroma, dark chocolate and toasted malt, dry finish.

Beczka. Barwa czarna nieprzejrzysta z niską beżową piana. Piana różnej wielkości utrzymująca się do samego końca. Aromat palonych słodów, kawy. W smaku dominuje kawa z czekoladą z wysoką palonością. Piwo prezentuje charakter wytrawny, goryczka dobrze zaznaczona. Brak pełni jak na dobrego Imperiala przystało.Pozostaje gorzki posmak w ustach i duży niedosyt po takiej kooperacji świetnych browarów.

Bottle 500ml @ Sommerhuset
Pours pitch black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, citrus, rye, coffee and licorice. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long roasted, chocolate, coffee, citrus and bitter finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Draught
Aroma-caramel, coffee
Appearance-black, hazy, brown foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, light sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter finish
Overall-very good

Bottle. Pours black with a tiny off-white head. Aroma of chocolate, roasted malt, some soy and caramel. Flavor is sweet and roasted with some rye, chocolate, ash, grains and caramel. Medium body, average carbonation.

500 ml bottle from The Hoppy Imports, Thessaloniki Greece. Black body with dark brown head. Aroma is really strange. Spiciness from the rye, something like peppers, coffee, chocolate, some hoppiness. Taste is similar, and quite strange and balanced. Coffee and chocolate of course, with spicy rye notes, roasted, some hops there as well. maybe some beechwood, some oak. Medium to full body with medium carbonation. Great!!!!!
From tap at Ørsted Ølbar, Copenhagen. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, caramel, rye, hops, fruit and chocolate.

Bomber. Black with a big tan head that seems to have an amber tint, too. A cool looking beer. A robust and roasty aroma also seems to have that regional aroma. Some chocolate and ash in there, too. The flavor is also robust. Dark bitter chocolate leads. Floral notes and ash. Interesting. Then spicy hops. The beer settles into a rich chocolate and rye stout but continues to evolve. Soft fruit pops up followed by grapefruit bitterness. Very good. The feel is creamy smooth. An awesome beer.

Kul sort, brun tæt skum der hænger i glasset, en duft af kaffe og lidt stald, meget bitter tør afslutning der bider lidt i kinden.

Free Føroyar!!!

Pours pitch black with a nice lacing. Aroma: roasted malt with coffee and some sweet elements. Taste: Very smooth, with roasted malt aroma, with a nice robust roasty finish. A nice one. Well hidden ABV.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2016 Tap @ basement beer bar. Aroma of roasted malt, some smoke, some rye bread. Black with tan head, tiny lasting. Light sweetness, moderate bitterness, a bit harsh. Full body, oily texture, light carbonation, malt bitter finish.

Bottle shared at home. Thanks Pepso for the bottle!
Black with brown head. Dry and spicy aroma, black pepper with some coffee. Bitter and dry and yet smooth. Full body, a little dry mouthfeel, lots of very bitter chocolate finish. Great!
50 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with a tan head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are roasted malt, rye, coffee, and chocolate - with a dry finish.
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pitch black pour with a small tan head. Lots of roast, fresh coffee, malty, bitter chocolate, some savory licorice. Delicious!

fra fad
duft. kaffe ristet malt chokolade. dyb duft meget kompleks i duften

smag sød frisk din smag af kaffe chokolade ristet malt. sødme og frisk humle smag lidt citrus. meget kompleks øl
Aroma is dark malts, mildly vinous and chocolate. The flavor is dark malts, coffee, rye, mildly vinous, chocolate and aan acidic/warming/slightly sour finish.

Black with small tan head. Roasted aroma, some rye and strong sweet coffee. Flavour has more of the same along with raw licorice. Long lasting, strong and slightly rough bitterness. Heavy but well balanced. Good one.

Tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Aroma has a loooot of rye, slight smoke, Dark chocolate, coffee. Taste is very roasty bitter, slight malty sweetness, some malt, again lots of rye, dry finish. Medium carb and full body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2015 Tap. This one is rye bread! Pours pitch black with really nice creamy thick brown head which lasts for a long time. Aroma is hard roasted malts, roasted coffee, some spicy rye, anis, dark chocolate along some grassy hops. Makes is reminiscent of citric espresso. Taste is very roasty and dark. Dark malts and coffee along the anis and spicy rye. Dark bitter chocolate and same kind of espresso as aroma. Body is rather full and really smooth with dry roasty and bitter hoppy finish. Really nice for the ABV, feels like more and is also bit noticeable as i warms.

Pours very dark brown with a dark burnt orange head. The aroma has very roasty malt, milk duds, dark caramel, figs, dates, cream and some licorice. It has a thick rich body with a bit of roughness and semi-sharp carbonation. The flavor starts with rough roasted malt, rye spice, woodiness, bitter bakers chocolate, spice, pine and rough earthy harshness. The finish has licorice, molasses and lots of rye spice. Good, but very rough tasting.

Purchased at the Hoppy Imp. (Greece) and consumed in Kosovo, bottle. Pours oily black with brownish (dark) coffee-like foamy head. Nose: prominent licorice, lactose, mocha. Also a grassy note far away. Mouth: coffee beans with a grassy-bitter palate and a dry end. Medium carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Botella. @El Cabanón, Avilés 07/03/2015. Batch:924. Color negro turbio, espuma beige. Aromas torrefactos, Cuerpo alto. Seca y amarga.

Botella de 50 cl en el momento el 28-02-2015 En el lúpulo. Lote 924 Hasta 11-2016. (r156) color negro intenso con espuma oscura poco persistente. Aromas intensos, maltas tostadas, algo ahumadas, cacao y herbáceos amargo. Cuerpo intenso con 7.7 vol, bastante pastoso y con carbónico. Sabores intensos, maltas tostadas, cacao, algo de café y bastante herbáceo ligeramente resinoso y seco que deja un buen amargo duradero. Bastante buena, para repetir sin duda, seca y amarga.

Aromat: palone słody, kawa, nieprawdopodobne uderzenie czekolady, chmiel amerykański pod postacią owoców i żywicy, ale tylko w tle.
Wygląd: perfekcyjny stout
Smak: kawowo-czekoladowa baza z mocną paloną goryczką, posmakami owoców tropikalnych i żyta, do tego karmel, ciasto czekoladowe i lekko grzejący alkohol
Niesamowite oblepiające odczucie w ustach - niejeden RIS by pozazdrościł.

Dark brown, almost black. Has a light brown head. Roasted, fruity notes, sweet notes too in the aroma. Flavor starts sweet and roasted, some odd medicine notes.

From a 50 cl bottle at home in Skövde. Dark brown beer with a beige greamy head. Coffee, licorice, tar aroma. Licoricelavour was a bit thin.

Bottle. Black beer with a nice brown head. Roasted aroma, soot, dark chocolate, ryebread, hoppy, malty notes, some coffee. Roasted tar flavor, soot, peated, ryebread, hops, cocoa, dark chocolate, milky notes. Quite roasted tar finish with hops, cocoa and some licorice.

Bottle @ tasting. Aroma is sharp roast, some rye, touch of Orval like sourness. Infected? Flavour is deep bitter & dry liquorice, roast, some wood in the finish. Big roast with a touch of Orval like brett, whats not to like?
Tasting @ De Molen Dark, nice brown head. Funky aroma, like lemongrass. Taste at first is also lemon, then some sweetish chocolate and then lemon bitterness again. Infected?

Dark black, creamy medium tan. Nutty, roasted pine nuts, double cream. Sharp start but throughout the taste as well. Very full body, roasted. Hops are only to give a dryness. Hint of wild yeast. Tough beer, tough drink, quite nice. Taste grows on you. (At De Molen tasting)
Bottle at dEnks montly tasting session @ De Molen. Aroma is somewhat meaty, wet dog, some coffee and roasted. Flavor is bitter roasted, quite dry and harsh. Still quite nice.

Bottle. Didnt get much of this, less than 10 cl actually, as I used it to marinate my cellar floor. Well, it poured a really dark brown body, almost black, topped by a two-finger, tan head that lasts. The aroma escaping my cellar floor and glass had loads of dark chocolate, as well as coffee, salty licorice, piney hoppyness and an almost boozy touch. Its full-bodied and warming in the mouth, silky and smooth, with flavors of roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee, salty licorice and bitterness. Sweet, yet dry, finishing mostly dry. A bit thin in the finish maybe. Overall, a beer thats both tasteful, balanced and sort of easy drinkable. Didnt sense much of the smoked malt, would be interesting if that was beefed up a little bit. 111207
Bottle from De Molen. Almost black color with huge frothy beige head. Aroma of black fruit, coffee, caramel. Taste, coffee, chocolate, black fruit. Nice long bitter finish.  Nice stout.

UPDATED: DEC 6, 2014 Pours black with a tiny light brown head. Aroma is roasted coffee, rye, dark chocolate, vanilla, dark fruits and very gentle smoke. Taste is nice roasted malts, coffee, rye is there too, hops, chocolate, some dark fruits, vanilla and liquorice. Very nice porter indeed. Got the one again from Papsø- Thought I did not have it before - which turned out not to be the case. Well. Lots of rye in the aroma along with roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate,. weak vanilla and liquorice. Taste of the same. very roasted and smooth! Really a nice stout1 Ill stick to 3.9 on this one!
On tap. Poured black with a slight head. Chocolate, roasted malts, anise. Some bitterness. Manages to stand out.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2013 Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Rated on 5.10.2011.
Pours a black colour with a small beige head. Aroma of smoked and roasted malts and extremely strong licorice. Heavy flavour of roasted malts, bread, salty licorice, dark chocolate and bitter hops. Full bodied, smooth mouthfeel and a finish of roasted malts and wood. A top-notch stout.8-4-8-4-16 4.0.
500 ml bottle.
Pours a pitch black colour with a small head. Aroma of roasted malts, yeast, chocolate and grass. Flavour of strong roasted malts, milk chocolate, licorice, grassy hops and strong rye bread. Pleasant bitternessa as well. Full bodied, oily mouthfeel and ra warming, roasty, quite bitter finish. Pleasant. 8-4-8-4-16.

from erzbierschof.ch - dark black beer with a long lasting dark beige foam; nice lacework; roasted and perfumy aroma with notes of licorice, ginger and black cherries; full-bodied and with a velvety palate; a solid bitterness, long and very tasty aftertaste of licorice, corn, coffee and chocolate - lot of character and pretty original profile
bottle in de molen que ... deep dark black ... slight sour woody toffee roast malt nose ... dark heavy roast ... big chocolate ... smooth soft mellow roast ... nice .
Bottle. Roasted coffe toast malty black bread aroma. Black. Small head and heavy body. Strong roasty flavours. Gentle bitterness. Great brew collaboration.
Black with a light brown head. Aroma is sweet, hard roasted malt, coffee and dark chocolate. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Smooth with a roasted bitter and dry finish. 040910

Dark brown/black, brown head. Rich, roasted malt, smoke, hops, chocolate, coffee beans, earth. Dry, full bodied, high bitterness. Very rich and complex, massive, roasted malt, smoke, cocoa, coffee. (2010-11-21)
Bottle. Black colour with a tan head. Aroma is fruit, coffee, rye, hop, smoked, malt. Flavour is fruit, coffee, smoked, malt, hop, rye, licorice. Full body. Very nice beer.

Its pitch-black with a brown, creamy and lasting head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt, rye, licorice, but also a little barnyard. The mouth-feel is nice. The flavour has notes of hard-roasted rye, salty licorice and a little sourness/barnyard. I cannot find smoke in neither aroma nor flavour, and the barnyard is a draw-back for me.

Bottle, 50cl. Pours a pitch black beer with a chocolate brown head. The aroma is malt, rye, spices, roasted and notes of smoke. The flavor follows the nose closely. The palate is roasted with sweetness. Overall a really good beer.
Bottled. Dark color, medium head. Aroma of roasted malts, rye, some molasses. Quite bitter taste, bit sweet.

From Salling, Aarhus, DK.
Bottled, 150111.
Black with beige head. Aroma of roasted malt. Flavor with spices and coffee

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2015 First rating: Medium dark brown head. Opaque black body. Roasty earthy chocolate aroma is fairly mild. Dry-sweet roasty earthy faintly acidic taste with coffee notes. Mild, soft mouthfeel. Fullish body. Dry earthy roasty rye taste with coffee and charcoal notes. Nice. Has awesome character, and is very balanced and harmonic. (0.5l bottle, Ølbutikken, Copenhagen.) 6,4,7,3,14=3.4

Second rating: Medium brown head. Opaque black body. Roasty spicy licorice aroma with mealy earthy notes. Dry-sweet roasty burnt spicy taste with perfumy notes. Mid-bodied. Mild, soft, mealy mouthfeel, somewhat dense and oily. Sweetish roasty earthy licorice aftertaste with dusty perfumy wooden notes. Nice, drinkable, a bit odd. (0.23l draft at Taphouse, Copenhagen.) 6,4,6,3,13=3.2

Pitch black with a lasting tan head. Aroma dominated by chocolate, with some fruit, and weaker hints of smoke, spice and licorice. Lots of hop flavour along with licorice and roasted malt. Hoppy and bitter finish

Bottle @ Odense Tasting December, 2010. Pours black with a creamy beige head and lacings. Nose is rye, chocolate and coffee roast. A bit of smoke. Fruity roasted flavor with ashes, rye and hops. Smooth. Good.

Bottle This beer rocks! Pours pitch black with a mid-sized, creamy, khaki head. Never-ending retention. The aroma is a bold, scorched blend of charcoal, molasses, pouch tobacco and tons (I mean TONS) of dark chocolate and espresso to create the most wonderful, hearty, Cuban-like mocha. Full-bodied with a plush mouthfeel and soft carbonation. The flavor supplies lots of hop and scorched black malt bitterness with a nice, not-so-subtle compliment of rye spiciness. Burnt, bitter, espresso and dark chocolate finish. There is absolutely nothing subtle about this overbearing, bad-to-the-bone brew. World class bottle of beer courtesy of Plovmand!

50cl Bottle from De Bierkoning. Black colour, beige-brown head. Aroma of tart berries, hard roasted malts, light citrus hops, bitter chocolate. Flavour is light sweet, malty, hard roasted malts, very bitter, espresso, plain chocolate, light tart berries, hard roasted bitter light hoppy finish. Medium bodied. Dont really know if the tartness was intended, spoiled it a bit for me.

Once again the android Ratebeer mobile app didnt record my rating, gotta love that...Anyway, the ever generous Hopscotch shared this one with me. Spicy herbal rye aroma, pepper, dark chocolate, and light smoke. Thick bodied, almost oily, but with a very a balanced finish. Spice, pepper, chocolate and roast flavors. Very enjoyable.

Pours black with a nice and creamy nazelnut brown head. Aroma is a punch of hops and roasted malts. The roast is really robust, bitter cocoa powder, a fairly obvious smoke component, some roasted nuts and a bit of caramel. Hops are piney, a bit lemony and add a nice touch to the heavy roast. The taste is very roasted as well. Bitter, bitter espresso, hints of smoke, a wee bit of burnt caramel sweetness and just hops by the bucketload. Insanely bitter for a stout, just a facepunch of bitterness in the after taste. This is like a psyched up hybrid between Beer Geek Breakfast and Dark Hops. Screw balance, just hop it up. But as a hop lover, I can only indulge in the bitterness. A good beer to end the day.
Pours black with a light brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, liquorish, pepper and light smoke. Flavour is roasted malt, smoke, chocolate and liquorish.
Black of color with a nice big brown head. An aroma of leather, coffee, roasted malt, dry and hops. A flavor of malt, chocolate, bitter, leather and coffee
Nose of heavy fruity hops, barn yard, late smoke and salt, feel is wine-like, carb is weak, taste is dry fruit, some earthy notes,
Bottle. Low fluffy brown head. Pitch black body. Coffee cocoa vanilla wood aroma. Slightly sour coffee spicy sharp rye flavor. Low carbonation. Long aftertaste.

Quite much pitch black colour with a big foamy beigeish brown head. Aroma is fruits, some chocolate, roasted malts, mild rye as well as some slight coffeeish notes. Flavour is quite much the same with some slight sour wooden notes in addition to it. Also some mild yeastyness.
Looks great in the glass with a black look and thick creamy brown head. Strongly roasted aroma with sweetbread and peaty notes. Dry smoked flavor with bitter roasted notes. Powerfull and well brewed.

Bottled. Pours opaque, black with a brown glow and a 1 1/2 fingers high, creamy and deep beige head. Excellent lacings. Nose of roasted malts, chocolate and notes of smoke. Rsther dry flavour with, bitter chocolate, coffee and liqourice. Full bodied. Oily texture. Nice and malt bitter finish. Balanced and enjoyable.

Bottled at Monks Porterhouse, Stockholm.  Very black, rich beige head. Heavily tary and salty. dense and full bodied with rounded mouthfeel. Rather sweet and oily with big bold flavours. Drying out in a finish with salty bitterness and notes of old damp blanket.

Bottle from Ørsted Ølbar og Café. Black with a big, creamy, light brown head. Delicate spicy fruit nose. Sour notes, tart berries, chocolate hints and roasted coffee. Not easy to detect the smokiness though there are some hints; it is more Belgian in character.

Bottle at home. Poors an opaque black with a beige head and hints of lacings. Bitter and some sweetness. Aromas of toasted malts, dark chocolate, rugbrød and some brettanomyces. Medium to full bodied. Medium carbonation. Dry finish with coffee aromas. Good.

Bottle. "Black with a rich dense pale brown head. Rich aroma of roasted malts, salty licorice, spices, red berries and dark chocolate. Nearly full-bodied with notes of black chocolate, cocoa-powder, spices, rye-bread and nut-shells. Smooth, bordering to sticky mouthfeel. Long medium-bitter finish of black chocolate, rye and spices. Well-hidden alcohol. Tasty!

Bottle, 7.7%. Vinous aroma, quite bretty. Black colour. Big stable brown head. The flavour starts off refreshingly bretty, then turns roasted and slightly sweet. Finishes with some grassy aroma hop notes, and more brett. Pleasant oily mouthfeel, quite smooth.

Bottle 50 cl. Medium big thick foamy brown head that mostly lasted. Fair display of lacework. Pitch black color. Aroma of mild roasted malt, hint of smoke, light floral feel. Over the palate came heavy unexpected lovely roasted malt, nice undertone of smoke, light wood like feel, mild pine and again floral notes in there as well. Medium to full bodied with an average carbonation and dry thick texture. Moderated bitter and sweet flavor in balance. Lingering roasted malt, liquorish, Smokey dry finish.  Well balanced and quite nice indeed.

Bottle 500ml.Clear dark brown black color with a large, creamy, good lacing, fully lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, choclate, strong coffee, acidic malt - coffee. Flavor is heavy sweet, light acidic and heavy bitter with a long duration, flowers, hops, acidic malt, acidic licoruce - english licurice. Body is medium, texture is oily to creamy, carbonation is soft. [20100921]

Bottle, bought @ LIVA, Kolding.
Exqusite looks! Deep black, no brown to be seen. Lovely staying, creamy, cappucino head. Wonderful duration and it leaves great, fat lacings on my glass. Aroma is elegant. Dark chocolate, dark berries, spiciness, rye bread (sour dough), some slight smoke. Low to medium carbonation, light and very dry mouthfeel with a little creaminess. Flavour is very different from a lot of other stouts. The rye is very evident, adding a lot of spiciness. Some roasted malts, mild smoke, light vinious. Mild dark chocolate. Heavy bitter hoppy finish. Long, lingering bitter finish with a good bitterness.

Pours black with a big creamy caramel coloured head. Aroma of rye (surdej), blackberries, coffee, chocolate and some smokiness. Flavour is nice and balanced with at hint of sweet toffee to balance out the rye and hops and spicey notes in the end. Very nice full palate and a long aftertaste of hops and spices.

shared by faroeviking. Black, smooth large lacing light brown head. 5  smoked sweet malty faint flowery aroma, roasted malts, hops. 7  flavor is hard roasted malts, sweet malts, bitter flowery hops as balance, coffee. Very nice. 8

Flöska. Pitch black colour with a huge brown bubbly creamy head, good lacing. Pleasant aroma of deep roasted malt, smoke, dark fruits and berries. Good mouthfeel. Flavour: roasted malt, smoke, rye bread, dark chocolate, dark fruits, Well lasting roasted maltiness, smoke, chocolate finish. Great brew!

Bottle; thanks to Papsoe, shared with Mes, Urbain. Narke, Raf, some other people at Borefts. Dark brown texture, excellent lacing, lovely malty nutty and rye aroma, really biscuity, awesome malt balanced, really great malty beer, sweet malts, heavy amount of rye bread, biscuit texture, really nutty on the palate, really awesome beer. Thanks so much Papsoe.
Sample from unlabeled bottle @ BBF 2010. Rye bread and smoke in both aroma and flavor. Some tart notes next to the smokiness, that goes on and on in the aftertaste.

Bottle. Pours a black color with a small longlasting tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate and licorice aroma with some hints of smoke, also some hints of hops. Roasted malty chocolate and licorice flavor with some smoky hints. Has a roasted malty chocolate finish with some bitterness in the aftertaste.

50 cl bottle thanks to Marko, on September 24, 2010BB 07.02.2014, but fairly difficult to see the month in writingBlack color, lasting brown head. Sweet, slight bit acidic, smoke scent. Also licorice, some lactic, roasted, smell, fresh. Roasted, acidic, grainy, coffee, lactic taste. Coffee and roasted malt aftertaste. The long dry finish really lingers. Moussy moth feel. Medium high bitterness.

Bottle (batch no.272? cant read it properly). courtesy of the Amager crew and Papsoe, HUGE thanks! Pitch black body, darker tan-brown head. Relatively soft sweet creamy coffeish roasty nose, quite pleasant. A balanced sweetish, sorta creamy taste, with light sweet notes bordering on fruity, peachy even. A nice, balanced stout. Quite drinkable. My type of stout :).
50cl, new exclusive Danish brew Anno 2010, thx to Jeppe!, complex smoked Stout, balanced, hazy, rocky head, good brew, but expensive

Bottled. Pitch Black coloured. Brown dense head. Cocoa, roast, liqourice, light smoke, vague chocolate in the aroma. Brown sugar, roast, vanilla, herbs, flowers, light smoke in the flavour. Medium to full bodied. Roasty sweet bitterness in the end. Very Nice.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours opaque and pitch black with a small and creamy light brown head. The aroma is dominated by hard roasted malts and dark bitter chocolate. Medium body with a delicious velvety mouthfeel. Hard roasted malt and great chocolate accents. I dont really get any smoke notes though. Ends with a malt bitter finish. Robust yet subtle. 290610
50 cl bottle @ FairBar. Black with small brown head. Flavour is roasted malt, rye, creamy, smoke, coffee, chocolate and a little acid.

Bottled. A black beer with a brown head. The aroma has notes of sweet and roasted malt and caramel as well as lighter notes of fruit. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of dark chocolate, caramel, roasted malt, and hops as well as a light rye note, leading to a dry roasted finish.
Bottle at home - shared with Mette & Morten. Black - brown head. Chocolate, coffee, burned, medium hoppy, high malty, dry bitterness, dry burned, lovely.

50 cL bottle, courtesy of Ungstrup. Pours dark brown to black with a small tan and chocolate brown head. Aroma is dark roasted malt and vague fruity. Dark malty, distinct breadish and mild acidic. Lasting dry breadish. Lasting dark breadish and roasted malty finish.

Black with a large deep beige head. Sweet and sourish aroma with smoke, burned malt and rye. Sweet flavor with burned malt, dark chocolate, rye, english liquerice, smoke and hops. Finished dry and bitter.

21-AUG-2010, bottle @Erik, brough and served blind by me(!).
Looks like a cake:)
Dark brown head on almost black body.
A little smoke on the nose, but mostly a dark fruity tary note that I like.
Burned rope, very very creamy. In some ways remind me of a Mikkeller Texas Ranger without the chili.
Again a very fine brew from the locals:)

Bottle at the brewery. Pours pitch black with a brown creamy head. The aroma is quite fruity and very roasted with notes of chocolate and coffee. The flavour is roasted malt, fruit, rye and chocolate. Very balanced. Great!

Bottle at home.
Black coloured with a fast disappearing beige head.
Roasted aroma of brett, berries and hops.
Roasted flavour of dark chocolate, coffee and hops with notes of brett and berries.
Dry roasted finish.
